questions/english/IM/01. Newspapers/01_Q: I want to know about restaurants in your country. What are typical restaurants like?
Tell me about a restaurant you ate at recently. What kind of restaurant was it? What did you eat there? And who did you go with? Did you like how the food tasted?
Now, tell me about a restaurant you used to go to as a child. What was it like? What do you remember most about that place? Tell me about that restaurant in as much detail as possible.
Talk about your favorite takeout or delivery food restaurant. What kinds of food do they commonly offer?
Talk about the last time you used a takeout or delivery food service. What did you get? What do you remember about that experience?

Talk about a time when you prepared for a special occasion using a takeout or delivery service. What kinds of food did you order from the restaurant? Tell me about that experience with lots of details.
How do busy working people usually get their meals on weekdays? Do they order food or go to restaurants? What do they usually do?
What do you usually do for dinner during the week? Do you cook your own meals or go out to eat? Does someone else cook for you? Do you eat alone or eat with other people?

Tell me about how you found out about a special grocery store. Maybe a new specialty store opened in your community or a new farmer's market opened, and you wanted to check that place out. How did you find out about this new store?
questions/english/IM/02. Television/02_Q: You indicated that you go to bars. Describe the bar you go to most often. Tell me everything about that place in detail.
Tell me about your favorite pub that you'd like to go to.
Tell me about what you normally do at bars. Who do you normally go with? Tell me everything about your experience of going to bars.
What do you normally do when you have gatherings at pubs? Do you call your friends first or go to the bank to get cash? Talk about what you do when you get together with your friends at pubs.
Tell me about a memorable incident that happened at a bar. What exactly happened and why was it special? Tell me everything about that unforgettable incident at a bar.
Tell me about a special visit to a bar or a pub. Maybe you celebrated your birthday there. How did you spend your time at the bar?
How have pubs changed over the years? How were they in the past and how are they now? What are the differences and the similarities?
Most bars and pubs have a special area to make drinks. Tell me what this area is like at your favorite bar or pub.
What is a typical routine for a bartender? How do they start their day? What do they do while they work? How do they end their day?
Tell me about the first bar you remember going to. What did it look like? Describe the first bar you went to with lots of details.
You indicated in the survey that you go to coffee shops. Tell me about the cafes or coffee houses in your community.
What do you normally do when you go to coffee shops? Are there meetings or gatherings there? Tell me what you like to do.
Tell me about a memorable incident that happened at a coffee shop. What happened? Who was involved? Tell me everything about that incident from beginning to end.
Talk about the first coffee shop you went to. What was special about that place? What do you remember most?
questions/english/IM/03. Internet/03_Q5-: Talk about gatherings or celebrations in your country. What do people do when they get together to celebrate things?
Where do people usually have celebrations or parties in your area? Is it at someone's home, a park, or someplace else? Tell me everything about that place in as much detail as you can.
What did you do at your last gathering or celebration? What was the occasion? Give me all the details.
questions/english/IM/03. Internet/03_Q7-: Talk about a memorable incident that happened at a gathering or a celebration. Why was it memorable or unforgettable?
Tell me about the last holiday party or celebration that you attended. Give me lots of details about what happened. Who was there with you? Tell me about what you did from beginning to end.
Talk about a time when you helped prepare for a party or a celebration. Perhaps you helped invite people, or you helped decorate the venue, or you helped get the food or drinks. Tell me about this experience from the beginning to the end.
questions/english/IM/04. Phones + Techno: Many people try to eat healthy these days. What kinds of foods are healthy, and why are they healthy for us?
Tell me how you found out about eating healthy. Did your family eat healthy when you were growing up? Describe to me in detail how you started to eat healthy.
When was the last time you had some healthy food? Who were you with and how did you feel? What was special about that experience?
What is a popular dish in your country? What is special about the dish? Please describe that dish in detail.
What do you eat on a regular day? Tell me everything that you eat in detail.
Tell me about a memorable experience you had while eating something. It could be good or bad. What happened? Why was it so memorable or special? Tell me everything with lots of details.
Describe a healthy person you know of. What makes that person healthy? Tell me everything about the things that make that person healthier.
Have you ever changed a habit or a certain lifestyle for your health? Maybe you started to work out or started to eat healthy. Tell me about that change you made.
Talk about one thing that you did for your health in detail. What kind of impact did it have on your health?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q1.mp3: You indicated that you like to go to the beach. Tell me about a beach that you like to go to. What does this place look like?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q10.mp: How has your country changed in the past decade? Perhaps there were changes in urban development or tourism. Choose one area of change and describe it with a lot of details.
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q2.mp3: What types of things do you like to do when you go to the beach? Tell me about the activities you typically do when you go to the beach.
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q3.mp3: Tell me about a particularly memorable or beautiful beach that you visited. What did this place look like? What was your impression of that place?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q4.mp3: Tell me about a particularly memorable trip to the beach. Who were you with? What did you do there? What made this trip to the beach more memorable than others? Tell me everything about this trip to the beach.
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q5.mp3: Describe your country's geography for me. Are there mountains, lakes, or rivers? What is your country like?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q6.mp3: Tell me about a country close to your country. Talk about what the country is like. And then tell me about its people and some of its traditions.
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q7.mp3: Tell me about the outdoor activities that are popular in your country. Do people go hiking, bike, or swim? What do people typically do outdoors?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q8-1.m: I would like you to pick a favorite place in your country from your childhood. Describe that place in detail. What do you remember about that place?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q8-2.m: Tell me about an early memory of your country's geography. Perhaps it was a special place or an important landmark. What were your memories about that place?
questions/english/IM/05. Music/05_Q9.mp3: People often have memorable experiences of exploring their country's geography. You might have climbed a famous mountain or might have swum at a beautiful beach. Tell me a story of when you visited a natural place in your country.
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q1.mp: You indicated in the survey that you like to take vacations domestically. Tell me about some of the places you like to travel to and why you like going there.
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q2.mp: Can you tell me about the things you do in order to prepare for trips?
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q3.mp: Tell me about some of the trips that you took in your youth. Where did you go? Who did you go with? And what did you do or see during those early trips?
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q4.mp: Traveling can lead to many kinds of interesting, funny, and unexpected experiences. Tell me about one travel experience you had that was unforgettable. Start by telling me when this happened, where you were, and who you were with. And then, tell me about all the things that happened that made this experience memorable.
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q5.mp: You indicated in the survey that you travel internationally. Could you describe for me one of the countries you've visited, what was it like, and what were the people like there?
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q6.mp: Tell me about a popular place tourists like to go to when traveling outside your country. Why do they like visiting those locations?
questions/english/IM/06. Movies/06_Q7.mp: Talk about the things that you typically do when you visit another country or city overseas.
Tell me about your first trip to another country or city. When did you go? Where did you visit? What did you do there? Who did you go with? Tell me about that trip with lots of details.
Think about another country that you visited when you were young. Describe what that country was like with lots of details. What was your impression of the place?
Sometimes, something out of the ordinary happens while traveling. I wonder if you have ever experienced anything surprising, unexpected, or unusual during a trip. Tell me about that experience in detail. Start by telling where you were traveling, and then give me all the details of what you did.
Talk about a specific incident you remember while you were traveling outside your country. Perhaps something happened that was funny, interesting, frightening, etc. Tell me what happened from beginning to end.
You indicated that you take vacations at home. Who are the people you meet and spend time with on your vacations?
Describe exactly what you did during your last vacation at home. Tell me what you did from the first to the last day. Talk about all the people you saw and what you did with them.
Could you tell me about an unusual or unexpected experience you had during a vacation you had at home? What happened? Who was involved? Why was this experience so memorable?
questions/english/IM/08. Housing 1/08_Q1: You indicated in the survey that you go to parks with adults. Tell me about the parks that you like to visit. What are they like and what is special about them?
You indicated in the survey that you'd like to take walks. Talk about the things you do when you go for walks. Where do you normally go? And how do you feel after taking walks?
questions/english/IM/08. Housing 1/08_Q2: Describe what a typical visit to the park is like for you. Tell me about the things you do and see at parks.
questions/english/IM/08. Housing 1/08_Q3: Tell me about the last time you went to a park. Which park was it? When was it that you went? Tell me everything you did from the moment you arrived at the park to the time you left.
Tell me about the last time you went for a walk. Where did you go to and what happened? What did you do to prepare for the walk? What did you do after you were done?
questions/english/IM/08. Housing 1/08_Q4: Tell me about a memorable incident you had at the park. Maybe there was a special event going on. Or maybe something unexpected happened. Start by giving me some background. And then give me all the details about what happened.
questions/english/IM/08. Housing 1/08_Q5: How did you first start going to parks? What made you visit parks in the first place? Why do you go to parks now?
Now, tell me why you started to take walks in the first place. How has your interest in taking walks changed over the years? Why do you take walks now?
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q1: I want to know where you live. Can you describe your home to me? What is it like? How many rooms does it have?
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q2: I want to know where you live. Talk about the different rooms in your home. Tell me about your favorite room in your home. What does it look like?
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q3: What is your normal routine at home? Do you do housework every day? What do you usually do on weekdays? And what do you do on weekends?
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q4: Describe the home you lived in as a child. How was it different from the home you live in now?
Talk about the place you lived and the surrounding area when you were a child. What do you remember about that place? Describe your home from your early childhood in detail.
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q5: Talk about a special memory you had at home with your family members. Perhaps you had guests over or had a party of some sort. Tell me about that experience in detail.
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q6: Sometimes, we want to change something in our home. Perhaps we get new furniture or do some painting or decorating. Talk about one change that you have made to your home. Tell me why you decided to make that change.
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q7: There are always problems that happen in any home. Things break. Projects do not go as planned. Or people you live with do not cooperate. Tell me about some problems or issues that you had at your home.
questions/english/IM/09. Housing 2/09_Q8: Pick one of those problems and explain everything that happened. When did it happen? And what caused the problem? Explain in detail everything you did to resolve the situation.
questions/english/IM/10. Furniture + Rec: Tell me about the furniture you have in your home. Is there a piece of furniture that is your favorite?
Tell me about how you use your furniture on a typical day. What kinds of things do you do with your furniture?
Tell me about the furniture that you had at home when you were a child. How was it different from the furniture that you used today?
Recycling is a common practice in many places. Tell me about all the different kinds of items that you recycle.
Tell me what recycling was like when you were a child. Was there a particular place to which you took out the recyclables? Describe what it was like and what you did in detail.

Problems sometimes occur while recycling. Perhaps the pickup service did not come as planned. Or the items were too big for the containers. Tell me about a memorable experience you have had related to recycling.
questions/english/IM/11. Work/11_Q1.mp3: You indicated in the survey that you like to watch movies. What kinds of movies do you like to watch? Why do you like those types of movies?
questions/english/IM/11. Work/11_Q2.mp3: Tell me about when you went to the movies recently. Who did you go with and how was that day? What did you do before the movie and what did you do after?
questions/english/IM/11. Work/11_Q3.mp3: What was a memorable movie that you watched in the past? What was it about? What was special about that movie?
questions/english/IM/12. Food/12_Q1.mp3: You indicated in the survey that you listened to music. What kinds of music do you listen to? Who are some of your favorite musicians or composers?
questions/english/IM/12. Food/12_Q2.mp3: When and where do you usually go to listen to music? Do you listen to the radio? Do you go to concerts? Tell me about the different ways you enjoy music.
questions/english/IM/12. Food/12_Q3.mp3: When did you first become interested in music? What kinds of music did you like at first? Tell me how your interest in music developed from your childhood until today.
questions/english/IM/12. Food/12_Q4.mp3: Could you think back to particularly memorable time when you listened to live music? When was it? Where were you? Who were you with? What happened that made that performance so memorable?
questions/english/IM/13. Health/13_Q1.mp: What do people normally do on the internet? Do they play games, watch television, or watch movies? Talk about all the things people do online.
questions/english/IM/13. Health/13_Q2.mp: What do you usually do on the internet? Do you like to shop online? Do you like sharing videos with other people? Tell me about everything that you do online.
questions/english/IM/13. Health/13_Q3.mp: Tell me about your early experience of surfing the internet. What do you remember particularly about that experience?
questions/english/IM/13. Health/13_Q4.mp: Tell me about when you use the Internet to get a project done. What was the project about? How did the Internet help you do that project?
questions/english/IM/13. Health/13_Q5.mp: What kinds of technology do people typically use in your country? Do people use computers, cell phones, or handheld devices? What are some common forms of technology that people use?
What do you like most about your phone? Maybe you like the camera or maybe you like certain applications. Tell me why you like those features and why.
What piece of technology do you use most often? Do you use computers or mobile phones? Tell me about the most typical type of technology you use every day.
questions/english/IM/13. Health/13_Q7.mp: What do you do on your phone besides talking to people over the phone? Do you make updates on your social media page? Do you play games? Tell me what you typically do on your phone.
Tell me about the first phone you used. How was it different from the phone you used now?
Technology has definitely changed over time. Tell me about an early memory that you have about a piece of technology. It could be a computer or a mobile phone from many years ago. How was that technology changed over time?
Tell me about a time when you had trouble while using your phone. What was the problem and how did you deal with it?
Problems often come up because of our dependence on technology. Think about a time when you experienced a problem because some piece of technology was not working properly. Maybe your computer crashed or maybe your cell phone had no service. Tell me about a time when you had some kind of problem getting the technology to work.
questions/english/IM/14. Restaurants/14_: You indicated in the survey that you like to go shopping. Talk about stores or shopping centers in your country. What are they like? Describe them in detail.
Where do you go when you go shopping for something? What do you buy when you go there? What is special about that place?
You indicated in the survey that you like to go shopping. I want to know about your shopping habits. How often do you go shopping? Where do you go when you shop?
When was the last time you went to shop for something? Where did you go and what did you buy? Who did you go with? What was special about that shopping experience?
Think of your early memories of shopping. Was there a store you remember from your childhood? What did it look like, and what was your impression of that place?
People sometimes go through difficulties while they are shopping. What were some problems you had to deal with while you were shopping?
What kinds of clothes do people in your country typically wear? Are there different clothes for work and for play?
What kinds of clothes do you like to wear personally? What kind of fashion style do you like? What are you wearing today?
Fashion styles are always changing. Tell me about the kinds of clothes that were popular when you were younger. How are they different from what is popular now?
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q1.mp3: Tell me about the weather at where you live. What is the weather like in each season? Which season do you personally like?
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q2.mp3: How is the weather today at where you are? Is it cold or is it warm? Talk about today's weather in detail.
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q3.mp3: How has the weather in your country changed over the years? What was the weather like when you were a child? How was it different from what it is now?
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q4.mp3: Severe weather conditions can do a lot of damage. Tell me about an experience you had related to severe weather conditions. Perhaps a city was flooded, or maybe businesses or schools were closed due to heavy snow. What was the problem? How do people deal with the situation?
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q5.mp3: Tell me about how people get around in your country. Do they drive their own cars or take trains? What are some typical means of transportation to get around?
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q6.mp3: What means of transportation do you use to get around? Do you drive or take public transportation?
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q7.mp3: How did you travel when you were a child? How was transportation different back then? Describe how people used to get around in your city or town.
questions/english/IM/15. Bars/15_Q8.mp3: Problems related to transportation often arise. Cars break down. Trains run late. Or traffic gets bad. Tell me about a problem that you once had related to transportation. What did you do to deal with the situation?
questions/english/IM/16. Gatherings/16_Q: What kinds of appointments do you make in your life? Where do you go to make your appointments?
What kinds of things do you do when you make appointments? Tell me what you do exactly when you make these appointments.

Talk about an appointment you made as a child. What was the appointment for? Was it for a doctor, a dentist, or a new school? What did you actually do and what happened when you got to your appointment?
Unexpected things can happen when you make an appointment. Talk about a memorable incident related to an appointment. What exactly happened and how did you deal with the situation?
Where do people in your country go to in their free time? Do they go to beaches? Do they go to parks or any other places? What are some popular locations that people go to in their free time?
What do people typically do in their free time? What is special about those activities?
Talk about your free time in the past. Did you have more free time or less free time? How was it different from your free time now?
Can you tell me about the last time you had some free time? When was this? What did you do? Who did you spend time with?
questions/english/IM/17. Domestic Trips/: Tell me about some popular holidays in your country. Where do people typically celebrate these holidays? What kinds of things do they do to celebrate?
Talk about a holiday memory from your childhood. Tell me where you were and what that place was like. Tell me everything that you remember from that holiday scene.
Talk about the most recent holiday you celebrated. Was there anything special about that day? Talk about why that holiday was particularly unforgettable.
Describe a family member or a friend you have. What is he or she like? What is special about that person?
Tell me about what you do with your friends or family members when you get together with them.
Talk about what you did with your family members or friends recently. Tell me about the activities you did with them.
Tell me about visiting a friend's or a family member's house. What do you normally do when you go there?
Talk about a visit to a friend or a family member from your childhood. Who did you visit and whom did you go with? What do you remember about that visit? What made the visit special?
Talk about a time when you visited a friend or a family member. What did you do when you visited them? What was memorable about that visit? Tell me everything from beginning to end.
questions/english/IM/18. Oversea Trips/1: Tell me about the banks in your country. What do they typically look like? Where are they usually located?
Tell me about the things you do when you visit the bank. What do you do from the moment you walk in until you walk out?
Banks have definitely changed over time. Tell me about a bank you remember from your childhood. What was it like? How was it different from banks today?

Sometimes, problems can rise when you are at the bank. Tell me about a problem you have experienced that involved your bank. Maybe the bank was closed, or perhaps the bank might have made some kind of mistake. Tell me about how you solved that problem.
Tell me about the hotels in your country. What are they like?

People often have memories of especially beautiful and interesting hotels. Tell me about a hotel that you remember for some reason. Where was it? What was it like? Describe it for me in as much detail as possible.
When was the last time you stayed at a hotel? Where was it, and why were you there? Tell me the whole story from beginning to end.
questions/english/IM/19. Geography/19_Q1: You indicated that you work. I want to know about your company. What kind of company is it? What products or services does it offer?
questions/english/IM/19. Geography/19_Q2: Tell me about your daily routine at work. What do you do when you arrive at the office? Tell me everything about your day at work.
questions/english/IM/19. Geography/19_Q3: Now, tell me about a project you did at work recently. What kind of project was it? What did you have to do for the project?
questions/english/IM/20. Parks + Walking: I enjoy eating at restaurants as well. Ask me three to four questions about the places I like to eat at.
I moved into a new house recently. Ask me three to four questions about my new house.
I like to watch movies as well. Ask me three to four questions about the movie I recently watched.
I'd like to go shopping as well. Ask me three to four questions about my recent shopping experience.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q1.m: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You would like to buy a new cell phone. Call a store and ask three or four questions about a new phone you would like to purchase.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q2.m: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have received the new phone, but the features are not what you expected. You would like to return it to get a new phone. Call the store. Explain the situation and make arrangements to get a new product.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q3.m: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever bought a piece of technology which was not what you wanted or different from what you had expected? Was the feature not what you wanted or did it just not work properly? Tell me about a time when you bought some new technology.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q4.m: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You want to get two tickets to see a performance during your vacation. Call the box office and ask three or four questions to get tickets.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q5.m: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. On the day of the performance, you are very sick. Call your friend and explain the situation. And offer two different options to resolve this situation.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q6.m: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever bought concert tickets, or made plans for a trip, or made plans for other things, but had to cancel because you could not make it? When was it? What happened? Tell me everything that you did to resolve it.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q7.m: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You want to take your friend to the movies. Call the movie theater and ask two to three questions to get tickets for you and your friend.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q8.m: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. When you and your friend arrive at the theatre, you discover that they've sold the wrong tickets to you. Explain the situation to the ticket seller at the booth. Offer two or three alternatives to solve the problem.
questions/english/IM/22. Fashion/22_Q9.m: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever bought concert tickets, or made plans for a trip, or made plans for other things, but had to cancel because you could not make it? When was it? What happened? Tell me everything that you did to resolve it.
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are at a clothing store and need to get some clothes. Ask two to three questions about the clothes you would like to buy.
questions/english/IM/23. Holidays/23_Q10: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. There is a newly opened store. Call your friend who knows about the new store and ask some questions about the store to get some information.
questions/english/IM/23. Holidays/23_Q11: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You left your wallet at the store. Call the store and explain your situation. Give several alternatives to solve the problem.
questions/english/IM/23. Holidays/23_Q12: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever left something at a restaurant or at a store? It could be your wallet, your cell phone, or anything that was important. Give me all the details.
questions/english/IM/23. Holidays/23_Q13: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. Your friend told you about a food store that he or she goes to. Call your friend and ask about the food store to get some information.
questions/english/IM/23. Holidays/23_Q14: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have accidentally left your groceries at the food store. Call the food store and explain the situation. Give two to three solutions.
questions/english/IM/23. Holidays/23_Q15: That's the end of the situation. Talk about the food store you go to. How did you first go there? What was special about that place?
I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. The clothes you have ordered have arrived, but one of the shirts has a problem. Call the clothing store and explain the problem. Give two to three alternatives to solve the problem.
That's the end of the situation. Have you ever been unhappy with something that you bought or some service you received? What was the problem? How did you deal with the situation? Tell me everything in detail.
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You see a sign at your favorite store that says that they are having a big sale. Go to the store and ask three or four questions to get as much information as possible about the sale.
I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. Once you get home with an item you bought, you realize that the item is damaged. Call the store and explain the situation and state what you want to do to resolve the situation.
That's the end of the situation. Have you ever bought something that did not work or was damaged? Explain what the item was, what was wrong, and what you did to resolve the situation.
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. There is a newly opened store. Call your friend who knows about the new store and ask some questions about the store to get some information.
I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You got some items from the store, but you accidentally left one item behind. Call the store and explain the situation. Ask them when you can visit the store to get your missing item.
That's the end of the situation. What was a memorable shopping incident you had? You might have gotten something as a gift for someone. What did you get? Who did you go with? Tell me about that shopping experience in detail.
questions/english/IM/24. Family + Friend: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are planning on going on a trip. Call a travel agency and ask three or four questions about the trip you want to go on.

That's the end of the situation. Have you ever traveled somewhere but missed a bus, a train, or a plane? Tell me about an experience you have had when you had difficulty getting to your destination. Start by telling me where you were going and why that happened. Then tell me what you had to do to finally get to your destination.

I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are planning on going on a trip to a country where your friend lives. Call your friend and ask about the geography there. And then ask two or three more questions regarding your travel plans.
I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You cannot go on the trip because of some reason. Call your friend and explain the situation. Give two to three alternatives.
That's the end of the situation. Have you ever been on a trip to another country? How is the geography there different from your countries?

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You got a phone call from a travel agent, and you have been informed that there is a problem with the trip that you wanted to go on, and it is not available now. Call your friend, explain the situation, and then give two to three alternatives.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have booked a non-refundable plane ticket. However, something has happened that prevents you from going. Call the travel agent. Explain what had happened. And offer two to three alternatives to resolve the problem.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. When you arrived at the airport, you were told that your flight is cancelled, and other flights are completely booked. Call your travel agency. Explain the situation and make two or three suggestions to resolve the situation.
That's the end of the situation. You may have had problems while you were planning a trip. What was the problem? And how did you deal with the situation?

That's the end of the situation. There are times when something out of the ordinary happens while traveling. I wonder if you have ever experienced anything surprising, unexpected or unusual during a trip. Tell me the story of that experience in detail.

That's the end of the situation. Have you ever had to deal with problems caused by cancelled flights? Describe that experience in detail. Tell me when and where this took place and what exactly happened. Talk about that story from beginning to end.

I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You need to buy a train ticket to go visit your friend this weekend. Go to the ticket counter at the train station and ask three or four questions to get the information you need to book a ticket.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. When you get to the train station, you miss your train and will be late to meet your friend. Call your friend, explain your situation, and offer some alternatives.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q1: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You have arrived in a new city and you're trying to find a hotel the night. Go to the reception desk of the hotel. Describe the room you want and ask three or four questions to get information about what is available.

I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are going on a vacation to another country. You want to know what clothes you should bring on your trip. Call a hotel in that country and ask two or three more questions about what the weather is like there.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. The clothes that you have brought with you on your vacation are not suitable for the weather. Call a clothing store and explain the situation. Ask two or three questions about the kinds of clothes they have on sale.
That's the end of the situation. Have you ever had any trouble due to unexpected weather? Tell me everything about what happened due to the unexpected weather.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q2: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You've learned that there are no rooms available in this hotel. Call your travel companions to let them know about the situation. Leave a message to describe the situation and propose alternative solutions to the problem.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q3: That's the end of the situation. Think about a time when your travel plans did not work out as expected. Tell me all about the circumstances, what you and the others did, and how the situation was finally resolved.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q4: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are staying at a hotel and have a free day to explore the city. Go to the front desk and ask three or four questions about what to do.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q5: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You left your bag in the taxi that brought you back to the hotel. Call the taxi company and explain what happened. Ask them how you can get it back.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q6: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever lost something somewhere or could not find something important? Tell me about when you lost or forgot something important.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q7: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are visiting a new city and need a hotel room for the night. Call a hotel and ask three or four questions to find out about its rooms and services.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q8: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. When you get to your hotel room, it is very small and not clean at all. Call the front desk and describe what you have found in detail. Then, make some suggestions as to how you can resolve the situation.
questions/english/IM/25. Free Time/25_Q9: That's the end of the situation. Sometimes surprising or unexpected things can happen when you stay at a hotel. Tell me about a memorable experience you had while staying at a hotel.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q1.m: You have heard about a new cafe in your neighborhood. Call the cafe and ask three or four questions to find out all about it.
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You have been invited to a friend's birthday party. The party will be held at a bar. Call your friend and ask three or four questions about the place that the party is going to be held at.
I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have a test coming up tomorrow and cannot make it to the birthday party. Call your friend, explain the situation, and give two to three alternatives regarding the situation.
I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You want to pay for the drinks at a bar, but you find out that you don't have your wallet with you. Explain your situation to the clerk and give several alternatives to solve the problem.
That's the end of the situation. Talk about a bar you'd like to go to. Why do you like to go to that bar? What is special about that place?
That's the end of the situation. Talk about a memorable incident that happened at a bar. Why was that incident unforgettable? Give me all the details.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q2.m: You placed an order for a delivery from a new cafe. When the order arrives, you realize that it is not the right order. Call the cafe and explain what happened and suggest two or three possible solutions to the problem.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q3.m: Have you ever been in a situation where you had ordered something in advance, but when you arrived it wasn't available? What did you order? Why wasn't it ready? What happened in the end?
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q4.m: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. Your friend's family member opened a new restaurant. Call your friend and ask three or four questions to find out whether you want to order food from that place.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q5.m: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have ordered lunch for a lunch meeting at your office. However, the delivery person brought you someone else's lunch box. Call the manager of the restaurant, explain the situation, and give two to three solutions to the problem.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q6.m: That's the end of the situation. Talk about a recent time you went out to eat with your friends or family. Where did you go and who did you go with? What did you eat? Tell me everything about that experience.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q7.m: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. A friend of yours has told you that a new bar is opening. Call your friend and ask three or four questions to find out more about the bar.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q8.m: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You are supposed to meet your friend at this new bar tonight, but you are not feeling well. Call your friend, explain the situation, and make two or three suggestions to go to a bar another time.
questions/english/IM/26. Weather/26_Q9.m: That's the end of the situation. We all remember specific bar or pub visits. Tell me all about the bar visit that was particularly memorable. Who was there? What happened? Describe that evening in detail.
questions/english/IM/27. Transportation/: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. Your friend has found a cool website. Call your friend and ask three or four questions about the website he or she has found.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. There is an emergency and you cannot make it to the session with your personal trainer. Call your trainer and explain the situation. Give some alternatives to make arrangements for a schedule change.
That's the end of the situation. Have you ever tried anything to become healthier? Tell me everything that you did to improve your health.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have tried to log on to that website, but there is something wrong with your web browser. Call the Internet Help Desk and ask for help. Explain why you need to get help as soon as possible.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have tried to check out that website, but it is not available. Call your friend. Explain the situation and make some suggestions to solve the problem.
That's the end of the situation. How did you use the internet to get a project done in the past? When was it? What was the project about? Give me all the details.

That's the end of the situation. Have you ever had any trouble on the internet? Perhaps you had difficulty using a website or you lost internet connection. What was the exact problem and how did you deal with the situation?
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You have an interview at a company. Call the company and ask three or four questions about the company.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. There is an emergency and you cannot make it to the interview. Call the company and explain the situation. Give some alternatives to make arrangements for a schedule change.
That's the end of the situation. Have you ever cancelled an appointment or a meeting for any reason? Why did you have to do that? And how did you deal with the situation?
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You want to enroll for a class at a fitness center. Call the fitness center and ask questions about their programs.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q1.mp3: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You need to open a new bank account. Go to the bank and ask the bank representative three or four questions to learn everything about you need to do to open an account.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q10.mp: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You are at a store and you see a piece of furniture that you like. Go to the clerk and ask three or four questions about the furniture you want to buy.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q11.mp: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. When you receive the furniture at home, there is a serious problem with it. Call the store. Explain the situation and offer two to three alternatives to solve the problem.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q12.mp: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever bought furniture but had a problem when you got it? What was the problem? And how did you deal with the situation?
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q2.mp3: I'm sorry, but there is a problem. I need you to resolve. You have left your new bank card at the restaurant where you had dinner. Call the restaurant and explain what happened. Describe your card and make suggestions to get the card back.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q3.mp3: That's the end of the situation. Can you remember a time when you had problems with a bank account, a credit card, or an ATM card? Perhaps you lost your card or the card would not work. Tell me about that experience you had in as much detail as you can.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q4.mp3: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You need to open a new bank account. Call the bank and ask the teller three to four questions about opening a new account.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q5.mp3: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You just got your credit card, but found out that there is something wrong with it. Call the bank, explain the situation, and solve the problem.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q6.mp3: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever had any problems with your bank card or had trouble while using banking machines or ATMs? Describe the problem you had in detail.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q7.mp3: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You would like to make an appointment to see the doctor. Call the doctor's office and ask three or four questions about things you need to know. And then set a time to go see the doctor.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q8.mp3: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. Something has come up that prevents you from going in to see the doctor. Call the doctor's office and explain the situation. Give two to three alternatives to make a new appointment with the doctor.
questions/english/IM/28. Banks/28_Q9.mp3: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever missed an important appointment or was late for it? What happened and what did you do? Give me all the details about that experience.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q1.mp: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You would like to find a house to live in. Call a management office and ask three or four questions about getting a house to live in.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q10.m: Tell me what recycling was like when you were a child. Was there a particular place you took out the recyclables to? How was recycling back then different from what you are doing now?
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q11.m: Describe a specific time in which you had trouble with recycling. It may have been a situation where you moved to a new place and did not know the rules, or you put the materials in the wrong containers. Describe what happened from beginning to end.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q2.mp: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have moved into the new house, but found out that one of the windows in your apartment is broken. Call the repair shop and explain why you have to get a new window as soon as possible.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q3.mp: That's the end of the situation. Tell me about a time when you broke something at home. What exactly happened and how did you solve the problem? Give me all the details from beginning to end.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q4.mp: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. Someone in your family is going on a vacation, and you have agreed to take care of his or her responsibilities at home. Call your relative and ask three or four questions to get all the information you need.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q5.mp: I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. When you arrive at your relative's house, the door is locked and the key is not where it is supposed to be. Call your relative's hotel and leave a message explaining the situation. Give two or three options to resolve the problem.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q6.mp: That's the end of the situation. Have you ever been in a situation where you agreed to do something for friends or family members, and then couldn't do it? Give me all the details about what you agreed to do, what happened, and how the situation resolved.
Suppose that you have moved into a new building. Call the manager of the building and ask three or four questions about recycling.
Suppose you just moved to a big apartment building. Call the person at the front desk and ask three to four questions about the building's recycling policy.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q8.mp: A new resident from abroad has just moved in. However, he is throwing away garbage in the recycling bin. Other residents are very upset about that. Go to the new resident, explain the situation, and tell him in detail about the recycling policy.
questions/english/IM/29. Hotels/29_Q9.mp: You often host large parties and take out most of the recycling and garbage the next day. However, other residents in your building are not happy about it, and one of them has come to complain to you. Explain the situation and offer some suggestions to resolve the problem.
questions/english/IM/30. Appointment/30_: I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You would like to buy an MP3 player. Call your friend and ask about the MP3 player he or she is using. Ask three or four questions that will help you decide whether you want to buy the product your friend is using.
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. A friend wants to go to the park with you this weekend. Call your friend and ask three or four questions to find out all you need to know.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You are supposed to pick your friend up in an hour to go to the park together. However, you have a problem and cannot go to the park. Call your friend and explain the situation. Give two or three alternatives about what to do.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You've just learned on the news that the park you are planning to visit will be closed this weekend. Call your friend. Explain the situation and offer two or three alternatives to the problem.

That's the end of the situation. Tell me the story of one very memorable experience you had while visiting a park. Maybe something funny, unexpected, or wonderful happened. Start by giving me some background about when and where this took place. And then, tell me why it was so unforgettable or special.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You have borrowed your friend's MP3 player but broke it by accident. Call your friend and explain how you broke it and what its current condition is like. And then give two or three alternatives in order to get another working MP3 player for your friend.
That's the end of the situation. Tell me about a time when a piece of equipment broke. What exactly happened? And how did you fix the problem? Tell me everything about that experience.

I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You want to borrow a bike from your friend to go to a shopping mall. Call your friend and ask three or four questions as to whether you can borrow the bike.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. You parked the bike that you borrowed outside the shopping mall, but the bike was run over by a truck. Call your friend and explain the situation. Give two or three alternatives to your friends.
That's the end of the situation. Now, tell me about a time when you had a problem while using a bike or any other type of transportation. What happened and how did you deal with the problem?
I'd like to give you a situation and ask you to act it out. You want to invite your friend to the beach, call your friend, and ask three to four questions regarding the trip you are planning.

I'm sorry, but there is a problem I need you to resolve. On the day of your beach trip, the weather is terrible. Call your friend and explain the situation. And then, offer several suggestions as to when you can make your trip in near future.
That's the end of the situation. Was there a time when you couldn't make to a trip to the beach because of the bad weather? What was the weather like, and what was the alternative to the situation?
